columns.name: RATE_OFFERING_GID
columns.description: The GID for the rate offering.

columns.name: X_LANE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the X Lane.

columns.name: MAX_CONNECTION_TIME
columns.description: The Max Connection Time field defines the maximum time allowed when planning any pair of consecutive shipments for inclusion in a continuous move tour. The connection time of any pair of consecutive shipments in a continuous move cannot exceed the max connection time. Connection time is defined as the time between the end of the first shipment being considered and the start of the second shipment

columns.name: MAX_CONNECTION_TIME_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the max connection time; days, hours, minutes.

columns.name: MAX_CONNECTION_TIME_BASE
columns.description: The maximum connection time in base units.

columns.name: MAX_EMPTY_DISTANCE
columns.description: The Max Empty Distance field defines the maximum empty distance that is allowed when planning any pair of consecutive shipments for inclusion in a continuous move tour. The maximum empty distance provides a way to limit the distance travelled to link shipments into a continuous move tour. If this field is not populated, shipments will be qualified for the same continuous move tour regardless of the distance required to connect them.

columns.name: MAX_EMPTY_DISTANCE_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for max empty distance. Typically MI or KM.

columns.name: MAX_EMPTY_DISTANCE_BASE
columns.description: The maximum empty distance in base units.

columns.name: MAX_REL_EMPTY_DISTANCE
columns.description: Max Empty Distance (%) is used to disqualify shipments that are too short in comparison to the distance travelled to include the shipment in the continuous move tour. Max Empty Distance (%) = 100*E/L, where E = Max Empty Distance L = Line Haul Distance of the shipment

columns.name: MIN_LINEHAUL_DISTANCE
columns.description: Shipments that are less than the minimum linehaul distance will not be considered for continuous moves/continuous move rates.

columns.name: MIN_LINEHAUL_DISTANCE_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for minimum linehaul distance. Typically MI or KM.

columns.name: MIN_LINEHAUL_DISTANCE_BASE
columns.description: The minimum linehaul distance in base units.

columns.name: MAX_TIME_AFTER_DELIV
columns.description: The maximum amount of time allowed between the last delivery of one shipment to the pickup of the next shipment. To create a continuous move, the second shipment must be picked up within a certain amount of time after the delivery of the preceding shipment. If this field is left blank, there is no time limit.

columns.name: MAX_TIME_AFTER_DELIV_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for the max connection time; days, hours, minutes.

columns.name: MAX_TIME_AFTER_DELIV_BASE
columns.description: The maximum time after delivery in base units.

columns.name: FREE_EMPTY_DISTANCE
columns.description: The free distance allowed between shipments in a continuous move tour.

columns.name: FREE_EMPTY_DISTANCE_UOM_CODE
columns.description: The unit of measure for free empty distance. Typically MI or KM.

columns.name: FREE_EMPTY_DISTANCE_BASE
columns.description: The free empty distance in base units.

columns.name: DOMAIN_NAME
columns.description: Database domain where this data is stored.

columns.name: INSERT_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data insert user.

columns.name: INSERT_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of data insert.

columns.name: UPDATE_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data update user.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of the most recent data update.
